facts.dispute: Trespassing goats and seizure attempt by deceased leading to fight.

legal_issues.primary_defense: Right of private defense of person and property under Section 97 of Indian Penal Code.
legal_issues.prosecution_argument: Illegal seizure of goats by deceased was theft.
legal_issues.defense_argument: Accused acted in self-defense after being injured.

judgment.initial_conviction: Section 302 Indian Penal Code - Death Sentence
judgment.final_conviction: Section 304(2) Indian Penal Code - Culpable Homicide

evidence.medical_report: Incised wound on accused's left palm caused by sharp-edged weapon.

key_points: Deceased were justified in impounding goats under Section 10 of Cattle Trespass Act.
Seizure did not amount to theft as there was no dishonest intention.
Minor injury on accused's hand could have been self-inflicted.
